## Linear Mixed Models

```{r, simpleGLMM-LMM-err-results-005, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.width = 8}

res.methods <- c(
   'full Gaussian',
   'one-step Gaussian',
   'one-step Generic',
   'cdf',
   'MCMC',
   'Unconditional ecdf, Rotated',
   'Unconditional ecdf, Not Rotated',
   'Conditional ecdf, Rotated',  
   'Conditional ecdf, Not Rotated',
   'Pearson'
)

pval.df.true <- filter.true(pvals, 
                            "simpleGLMM",
                            type_ = "LMM",
                             method.vec = res.methods)
pval.df.est <- filter.est(pvals, 
                            "simpleGLMM",
                            type_ = "LMM",
                             method.vec = res.methods)

pval.df.true$misp <- factor(pval.df.true$misp,
         levels = c('correct', 'missre', 'missunifcov', 'mispre'),
         labels = c("Correct",
                    "A: Missing RE",
                    "B: Missing X",
                    "C: Misp RE" ))


pval.df.est$misp <- factor(pval.df.est$misp,
          levels = c('correct', 'missre', 'missunifcov', 'mispre'),
         labels = c("Correct",
                    "A: Missing RE",
                    "B: Missing X",
                    "C: Misp RE" ))

err.table(pval.df.true, pval.df.est, 0.05,
        caption = "Linear Mixed Model. Type I error rates at the 0.05 significance level evaluated for each method for theoretical and estimated residuals.")
```

```{r, simpleGLMM-LMM-pow-results-005, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.width = 8}
pow.table(df1 = pval.df.true, df2 = pval.df.est, sig.level = 0.05,
        caption = "Linear Mixed Model. Power at the 0.95 significance level evaluated for each method for theoretical and estimated residuals.")
```

```{r, simpleGLMM-LMM-err-results-010, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.width = 8}
err.table(pval.df.true, pval.df.est, 0.1,
        caption = "Linear Mixed Model. Type I error rates at the 0.10 significance level evaluated for each method for theoretical and estimated residuals.")
```

```{r, simpleGLMM-LMM-pow-results-010, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE, warning = FALSE, fig.width = 8}
pow.table(df1 = pval.df.true, df2 = pval.df.est, sig.level = 0.1,
        caption = "Linear Mixed Model. Power at the 0.90 significance level evaluated for each method for theoretical and estimated residuals.")
```

## Randomwalk

```{r, rw-results-theor osa-true, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}

pval.df.true <- filter.true(pvals, "randomwalk",
                            type_ = "LMM",
                       method.vec = res.methods)
pval.df.est <- filter.est(pvals, "randomwalk",
                            type_ = "LMM",
                       method.vec = res.methods)
pval.df.true$misp <- factor(pval.df.true$misp,
         levels = c('correct', 'missre', 'hsk', 'm0', 'mispre'),
         labels = c("Correct",
                    "A: Missing RE",
                    "B: Heterosced.",
                    "C: Missing Drift",
                    "D: Misp RE" ))


pval.df.est$misp <- factor(pval.df.est$misp,
        levels = c('correct', 'missre', 'hsk', 'm0', 'mispre'),
         labels = c("Correct",
                    "A: Missing RE",
                    "B: Heterosced.",
                    "C: Missing Drift",
                    "D: Misp RE" ))


tbl.err.pow(pval.df.true, 
        caption = "Randomwalk Model. Type I error rates and Power evaluated for each analytical and simulation method for theoretical residuals using the KS normality test. Results are partitioned out by model mis-specification (from left to right) and residual type (top to bottom).")
```

```{r, rw-results-est osa-true, echo = FALSE, message = FALSE}

tbl.err.pow(pval.df.est, 
        caption = "Randomwalk Model. Type I error rates and Power evaluated for each analytical and simulation method for estimated residuals using the KS normality test. Results are partitioned out by model mis-specification (from left to right) and residual type (top to bottom).")
```
